Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific data or sources to support the statement that Arizona led the world in the highest number of COVID-19 cases reported every day per capita in early January 2021.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that leading health statisticians compiled the data, but it does not provide evidence or sources to support this assumption.
Understate: The claim may understate the severity of the situation by not mentioning the overall number of COVID-19 cases in Arizona compared to other states or countries.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why Arizona had the highest number of COVID-19 cases per capita, such as differences in testing strategies or demographics.
